website_summaries.verdict: This electric pole saw has a jaw-style blade for safety and swift managing of yard work.
pros: Jaw bar measures 6 inches with a 4-inch maximum cutting length
Includes extension pole that reaches limbs up to 12 feet high
Jaw-blade provides safety and precise cuts
cons: Pole saw is top-heavy when extended
Chain jumps off blade at times

website_summaries.verdict: The safety features make this a great choice if you're new to tree pruning, but it might not be able to tackle the largest, thickest branches.
pros: Electric pole saw with jaw guard to prevent injury
Quickly cuts through branches up to 4-inches thick

customer_reviews.title: This is a cool concept but the only benefit I can see
customer_reviews.text: Having growing up on 110 acres I am use to handling all kinds of tree trimming equipment. This is a cool concept but the only benefit I can see, is it cuts branches on the ground without having to prop the branch up for clearance. With the exstension, it is heavier than a pole saw. I have a lot of worx equipment and love them all, but you would be better off getting either a electric chain saw ( also sold by worxs) which is a lot lighter, or a pole saw ( depending on your project) It's just a little to heavy for a large projects. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: works fine, good value
customer_reviews.text: I have used chains saws for 40 years. its quiet. The chain stays on pretty well when cutting bush, but when it comes off its ackward to put back on. as far as the extention, its too top heavy ! BUT FOR THE INEXPERIENCED, this thing is far SAFER than a regular gas powered saw ! ZERO kickback and no danger of the chain flying back when it pops off.
customer_reviews.author: russell u neff  iii

customer_reviews.title: These type of jaws really are a woman's dream
customer_reviews.text: I am a widow so I needed to find away to cut tree limbs and dead branches. Since I already have the black n dealer jaws and love it , this has a long pole so you can reach higher tree limbs I purchased it. This is something a female can handle when it is only you. More safe then a regular chain saw. No gas to have to pour the chains stay in place. So women never need to fear this saw it is more safe.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Awesome design, makes it very versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool. Works great, built well. Worx makes great products. It is a bit heavy, especially with the extension attached. Cutting directly above is not bad other than the branches falling on you. When u cut with the tool out in front of u is when u will really notice the weight, as expected... great tool though. So much safer than a standard chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: CAN

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: If you have use a gas or electric chain saw or electric pole saw before and have them, do not buy this. It will dissapoint you. You have to press the handle to engaged the saw. That's makes it harder to use. The pole saw is actually easier to use because you just put it on top of the wood you are cutting and the weight and gravity take care of the cutting it down. Now if you don't have any of the tools I mentioned then go buy this or get the pole saw only. This is safer to use though but I still prefer the pole saw over this.
customer_reviews.author: DIY101

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw. It cuts well and is very powerful. Very handy for trimming trees around the house. It just eats wood, it grabs the tree branch and pulls it right in so that you don't have to place too much pressure on it. What's even better is their customer service. Ours stopped working because a part snapped inside. We called customer service and since we were under warranty, they were able to figure out what the next step was. It wasn't a part that could be replaced so they are sending us a new one to replace it. Great product and great customer service. You won't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: daiseyworld

customer_reviews.title: Chews right through the work!
customer_reviews.text: Great for making quick work of shrubs and branches let than 4". Did some quick pruning in the yard and didn't need to get out the load and messy chain saw. I wasn't sure how the mechanics of pushing to get the jaw to close and chain to slice would be... Took a little getting use to feel of using the unit, but it works great when on the ground. You cant bury the blade into the ground like a typical chain saw. Nice tool for the right project. Plenty of power and makes quick work of it.
customer_reviews.author: Drtoo

customer_reviews.title: Great tree cutter.
customer_reviews.text: What is great about this unit is buy have the extension on it I was able to reach deep into the branches and cut them off. Another thing is if you can get the branch between the opening it will cut it. If the branch is to big it will not cut which to me is a safety factor.
customer_reviews.author: James Babeshoff

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and now I know why-
customer_reviews.text: This is effectively the worst chain saw I own. The light duty it is supposed to bea provision for consistently is more than it can handle. The chain will not stay on, regardless of the number of times I reset it into position. I would recommend that WORX do some quality assurance or improve the consistency of this staying together long enought to perform the lightest of cuts. I would not recommend this product unless there was some explanation for the constant need to put the chain on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very simple and reliable saw
customer_reviews.text: If you can fit it in the jaws ,it will cut it.Ive used it for about 20 hours now.The chain has come off 3 or 4 times.I feel that's pretty reliable.I use the saw at many angles so it was probably my fault anyway.The saw comes with a tool to tighten and change the chain.I keep it in my pocket,when the chain comes off or gets loose I just unplug the power and fix the problem.It takes a couple of minutes to get the chain back on.Its a very simple design .
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Fallon

customer_reviews.title: Wow is all I have to say about a great tool. So tired of having to send out ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow is all I have to say about a great tool. So tired of having to send out one of my chain saws for carb cleaning every time I go to use them. I'm a once a year user and have found this to be perfect for what I need. Simply pull out, power up, use and restore. It is great for small limbing up to 5". Was light weight and cut through with ease. Pricing and shipping were great. Would strongly recommend this product, and ended up buying three more without extenders for Christmas presents this year...
customer_reviews.author: Johnny50g

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I was so looking forward to this, to get rid of difficult tree branch cutting, and I love this device! It makes it so easy and fast. It is pretty heavy at the top and takes some caution when you want to use it on top of a ladder. So not for you if you cannot lift something. But if you can, this will make your garden life so much easier and, frankly, fun!
customer_reviews.author: MO

customer_reviews.title: Love My JawSaw!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool!! Following the ice storms this winter, I had so many downed limbs to get rid of, and it was driving me crazy. I'm an older lady and not really strong, so a chainsaw was too heavy and dangerous for me to deal with. I wanted to be able to do it myself and give my friends a break. It worked like a charm and didn't require much muscle at all, just a long extension cord. I would recommend this to anyone with a lot of limb-dropping trees like oaks and pines that require constant clean-up. I also saved about $69 off the televised price. I am very pleased with it!!
customer_reviews.author: Joey Daniel

customer_reviews.title: this thing works great but it lost the pin to the works door ...
customer_reviews.text: this thing works great but it lost the pin to the works door on the first cutting task. but it works with the door removed so i will not try to return it. i love it cause my mother use to saw small limbs for her fireplace and now she just plugs in the WORX and saws them quickly and easily. Thanks people that make this and those that i bought it from. it is really a great everyday helper to my mother for her firewood gathering. JDE
customer_reviews.author: James D. Elton

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money if need to chop down bushes and shrubs!!
customer_reviews.text: We have had our Jawsaw about a month now, and we are very happy with it!! It makes quick work of cutting down branches and shrubbery. It seems a lot safer than a standard chainsaw. One thing my husband was upset about is the decision to spend the extra money for the 6" as opposed to the 4" saw. We were under the impression that the 4 or 6 inches was the opening of the "jaw". It isn't! This is referring to the length of a handle, which we are still not clear on. Anyway, just know that whatever size you buy, it does not change the size of the jaw. I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Cozad

customer_reviews.title: Buy this NOW!!
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to put in words how much I love this tool! It made cleaning up an overgrown and neglected yard so much easier. Many small trees had come up and this thing tore through them like butter! One of the best purchases I’ve ever made.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: its everything it advertises and more!
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of branches that fall from our big maple. This electric saw makes cutting up all the fallen branches easy. Great for my daughter who does her own outside chores, too. She uses the cut pieces for her fire pit. It took a little practice but it works easily pushing on the handle towards the wood to be cut.. Would recommend this to the older generation who are used to doing their own yard maintenance. The unit is not heavy. Have not tried the extension yet. That would add some extra weight, though.
customer_reviews.author: richard & emily west

customer_reviews.title: Saw workx nice. Extension....ahh not so nice.
customer_reviews.text: The saw itself works nice, but the saw with the extension handle attached makes it VERY top heavy. irregardless of what the advertisement says. While cutting multiple branches using the extension, my arms got very tired and while lowering the saw, it hit the ground bending the extension badly, making it completely unusable now. It appears that the extension itself is just a hollow piece of normal aluminum. I believe if it was made of aircraft aluminum, it never would have bent. Just my opinion. I could be wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Shadykennl

customer_reviews.title: JawSaw....
customer_reviews.text: We saw a commercial on TV, and thought it would be such a convenient apparatus. It IS, if used without the extension handle. If held in an upward position for any length of time, however, it becomes VERY HEAVY to hold. My husband is no "whimp," but could not address all of the tree branches that needed to be removed in a half-hour's time. The saw itself works beautifully, but with the handle, it's just too weighty.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey teacher

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick for the task at hand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw to take down a holly shrub that had overgrown. It was very easy to use for the task and I was able to take down two 10' tall shrubs in less than 30 minutes. I've also used this to take down some overhanging tree limbs. Operation is very easy and the unit is very maneuverable. The unit at the end of the extension pole is somewhat cumbersome, as it is fairly heavy. I was able to use it with little problem. Not sure how long it will last over time, uses a lot of plastic parts. For the price, it is a pretty handy tool to have around.
customer_reviews.author: SSN

customer_reviews.title: Good, but reservations
customer_reviews.text: This works very well, but has a couple of drawbacks: It is a little difficult to line things up properly when attaching the extension, and all of the weight is at the working end, so it takes a bit of strength to heft it around when the extension is in use. It does its job properly, though, and I am happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Douglas R. Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Heavy!
customer_reviews.text: Item is great, but heavy. I inteded to use this to help trim a tree that had branches about 18 feet up. I was on a ladder and had the worx jawsaw extended all the way out and the weight was damn heavy for me to hold there cutting more than one branch. The box shows a women holding it up like nothing and my wife couldn't lift it above her shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Beats heck out of our "chain saw on a pole"!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not certain what folks expect out of the extension, but the JawSaw *with* extension certainly exceeded *MY* expectations. We have owned a couple of those little chain saws mounted on an extension pole in the past and I've found it very difficult to keep them from dancing around on the limb instead of sawing in one spot. I experienced no such problem with the JawSaw! (I'm 70+ years old). Cut a 4" branch about 11' off the ground with no "dancing". While the claim is 12', that would put this old boy under what I was cutting and that just doesn't "compute". The wife has used our JawSaw without the extension with absolutely NO problem! Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Stites

customer_reviews.title: It has it's place.
customer_reviews.text: Will cut anything that fits in the jaws. Awkward for cutting anything at the max height. Best for cutting up downed limbs but not really needed for smaller limbs-a lopper is much faster. Good for those scared of using a chainsaw or those inexperienced with a chainsaw. They can use the jawsaw while i run the chainsaw. If the ground is soft when you do a push cut it can cut into the dirt. Nice tool to have but not do-all type of tool-it has it's place. Nice compliment to the chainsaw, pruner, and lopper. I also used it to cut landscape timbers to make a firewood rack.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kiser

customer_reviews.title: Not many Reviews and few 5 star
customer_reviews.text: I have blisters, cuts and stab wounds on my arms because I was clearing a 20x70 foot section of our fence. If I would have tried to do that without the JawSaw I might have cleared a 10x10 section in a week. I know this is kind of a backward way of saying the product was fantastic, but it was! Anything less than 4" dia is dead meat with this saw. Took me a few minutes to figure out the extension handle but well worth it. I have had many different chain saws in the past, but this tool takes the cake. Good product, well thought out. get it.
customer_reviews.author: PoliceLivesMatter

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product at the insistence of a family member who had some branches that needed to be trimmed. I was content just to use my chainsaw, which I hadn't started in 5+ years. But once this product arrived, I found it super easy to use and I had the job completed in less than 30 minutes - including cutting the small limbs to size for her stove. The design is rather ingenious and it is very safe and soundly constructed. This is one product that I would highly recommend for any sort of light to medium duty tree trimming.
customer_reviews.author: R. Crockett

customer_reviews.title: A safe alternative to a conventional chain saw.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am happy with this purchase. If you simply allow the saw to do the cutting and do not push it or force it, it cuts cleanly. It is very safe to operate. However, do not expect this to be a complete alternative to a conventional chain saw. You are limited by the width of the jaws, so you are able to cut anything up to approx.4", maybe 5". It can get fairly heavy after a while, but you can compensate by putting the stationary jaws over a limb, thus taking the weight off yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Ahrens

customer_reviews.title: Well designed by someone who thinks "outside the box"
customer_reviews.text: Although I needed to return my first Worx JawSaw because the extension handle didn't work. Amazon took the saw and handle back without any questions and replaced both. The current units work fine and I am very pleased with the safety feature - the "jaws" that cover the blade. I have used it to cut fallen limbs and it works efficiently and far more safely than any of its' competitors. I am looking forward to cutting many low hanging limbs and others that are over my head using the JawSaw.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck L.

customer_reviews.title: Dont let your electric cord get in the way
customer_reviews.text: Love this, it's simple and easy to use, it works fantastic and you can clear Alot.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Marie

customer_reviews.title: I like the jaw saw.
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty much as advertised. It's actually somewhat fun to use. Saves me the trouble of hauling out the bigger chain saw on most trimming jobs. It looks like if one reads and follows the manufacturers instructions related to use and maintenance, it should have a long life. It also appears replacement parts for those that will eventually wear, like the chain, are available on-line. Besides, it looks so cool hanging on the garage wall. Dresses up the man cave well. Now if I could just add a Bose radio to the garage....
customer_reviews.author: G. D.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult task made easy.
customer_reviews.text: A great tool that certainly does a good job. I had a large grove of bamboo to eradicate. The "jaws" with the extension handle made short work of the bamboo patch. Bonus, now I have a tool that I can use elsewhere in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Carrillo

customer_reviews.title: What a great item for the home
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the WORX saw to take down small branches and to trim the crape myrtle trees in our yard. The saw is powerful and easy to use and cuts thru branches up to 6 inches like butter, This saw is a great purchase and made our life a lot simpler specially with the add on extension to get up higher without ladder,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: Worx jaw saw performs just as it states! Great tool for cutting small limbs and branches. I had a lot of long branches that needed to be cut to firewood size and the Worx jaw saw made it easy and fast 1/23/16 Just a quick update on this jaw saw...I am still loving it and using it a lot. I have cut all of my smaller sized firewood for this winter and cleared my property of limbs and branches. It is the easiest saw I have ever operated. It is amazing how it grabs onto the wood, rolls it into its teeth and cuts right through it quickly. Great quality and still sharp after all I've cut!
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Relativly safe for a chainsaw, works well and easy to maintain
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this model because the blade was enclosed in a protective housing, the housing does make it a bit difficult to get into tight spaces, but I managed to do everything I needed to do. I did accidentally cut through the power cord, I suspect this was operator error rather than a flaw in the machine ;-) . It works well and requires minimal maintenance between uses. (disassemble and clean out the protective housing, fill the oil reservoir.).
customer_reviews.author: Beth D

customer_reviews.title: A great tool
customer_reviews.text: Saplings grow quickly and keeping your outdoor places clear of them is a constant job means dealing with them...THAT I'VE HATED FOR YEARS!! This is so nice...I've used chainsaws for over 40 years and this tool is great for cutting hard to reach saplings without the user cutting their way into the pucker brush and all. Just put the pole on then slide it to the sapling and zip...it's down and a lot of them you are able to drag them out too! Easy and quick to sharpen too!
customer_reviews.author: C. Hartley

customer_reviews.title: I being a small female find it easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy tool. I being a small female find it easy to use. The only problem is that the chain kicks off the blade when it gets saw dust in the hood. Could be a manufacturing issue that should be addressed, however, it is not difficult to open the hood and realign the chain. Just frustrating when you get motivated to cut brush and limbs.
customer_reviews.author: Svrec

customer_reviews.title: WORX WG308 6 Inch Jaw Saw
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Easy to handle, particularly with the extension. Chain slips from time to time--5 times in about 2 hours, after using it on pine branches--from 1 inch to 4-5 inches in diameter. It was eacy to use, though, and work was fairly quick. I'm fortunate to have two 100 foot extension cords, so I can get stuff done about 203 feet away, which is helpful. I wish they had a gas version so I could cover more of my property where I have some tree/brush clearing that is needed. I'll know more after working with it more.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: What a great tool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this JawSaw because my wooded lot is aging and I have a fair bit of debris to clean up after storms. It works great. I wish I didn't have to drag an extension cord around for it, but if it were gas powered it would be much heavier and when on the extension would be too ungainly to use. The extension makes it heavy enough but you can get limbs you would otherwise have to get out a ladder to reach. The item arrived promptly and in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bundy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I had ask my husband for this for my birthday so he got it for me thinking it was going to be a silly thing. But lo and behold he loves it. We live on 60 acres and have a 4 block drive up to the top of a very brushy driveway. We use it with a generator and can get overhead hanging branches and side small trees and bushes. He finds it is so much safer then his chain saw. We are not youngsters and this works great and when he lets me take a turn he doesn't worry I will cut myself. SO glad we have it.
customer_reviews.author: Anitta York

customer_reviews.title: The tool is awesome..! could recommend to anyone...
customer_reviews.text: The tool is awesome...however I had 2 issues such as 1) The jaw got stuck in a tree branch that I was cutting and 2) the chain came of the track, but it was very easy to deal with and within minutes I was back in-action. Also I would like to mention that; it is not light as mentioned in the website, it is bit heavy duty tool and bit difficult to hold on to the extended handle if you do not have strong arms.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Works great out of the box,  BUT...
customer_reviews.text: The product works great the first time; On the second use the chain falls off even in spite of checking the chain tension prior to the second use. My only guess is that the chain is made of of 'light' metal that is prone to stretching with use. The chain is extremely challenging to re-attach. The directions are silent on this issue and you are left to guess how to accomplish the task. Overall the instructions are a complete waste of the paper they are printed on. Overall I liked how it worked the first time, frustrated with subsequent use. Summing up, it's fast to use, but slow to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool!
customer_reviews.text: The Jaw Saw is everything it claims to be. It was easy to assemble and simple to use. A tip for people who buy the saw... cut branches with the saw part up cutting downward. The branch will fall away from the blade that way. If you have it upside down, the branch will pinch the blade and make the blade keep coming off track. When you get the hang of it, You'll love it too.
customer_reviews.author: James Pittman

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I love my worx product and I continue to purchase worx products in fact I am in the process of replacing most of my yard tools
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Casebolt Jr.

customer_reviews.title: It actually works pretty well...
customer_reviews.text: I have had NO LUCK with the auto chain tensioner working right but if you force it to adjustment recommended in the directions it works just fine. The "auto tensioner" on my unit leaves the chain TOO LOOSE and I have not called the manufacturer about the issue yet but will get around to it. REALLY IS A LOT EASIER THAN USING AN OPEN CHAINSAW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: WORX WG308 6-Inch 5-Amp Electric JawSaw with Extension Handle
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to take out a row of bushes. Started by cutting out the wild mulberry trees. Size & weight of it made it very easy. Place jaws around unwanted tree "trunk", push the button, apply slight pressure, and let the chain do the rest. It takes longer to cut the downed tree to pieces for burn pile than it does to fall the tree initially. JawSaw on the extension handle is top-heavy. But once you get the "jaws" on the branch to remove, push the button, apply slight pressure, and let the chain do the rest. The hardest part of using the JawSaw is NOT to over use it. You'll want to trim all the trees in the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: W DAVID BROWN

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my 73 year old husband as ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 73 year old husband as an anniversary gift so he could trim branches on trees near our garden shed without straining so much. The unit is a bit heavy for him to handle with the pole attached though, as he has a constricture in the palm of his left hand, making it rather weak. He is able to use the jawsaw without the handle though, and found it much easier to use than the polesaw he had used before.
customer_reviews.author: nightowl1324

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for me!
customer_reviews.text: This is the safest way to clear brush or small enough trees. When someone was cutting down trees behind my yard, enough branches and limbs found a way into my back yard and I just had to get rid of them. My only problem is to prevent the chain from jumping off its track. Even so, it isn't impossible to fix pretty fast but a tad bit annoying for me. Maybe I'm just not doing everything perfectly but I do like this thing!! Buzzzzzzz away!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Dixon

customer_reviews.title: very heavy
customer_reviews.text: Too heavy for most women or weaklings for over head cutting. NOT for WIMPS....
customer_reviews.author: C.Smith

customer_reviews.title: A bargain at twice the price! Get one!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Other than being a little heavy (on the included extension pole) due to the works being waaaay out there, the JawSaw works like a champ! I cleared out four dozen small pine trees in about an hour with no problems at all. I don't think I'd go for the optional 5' extension pole, though. I've recommended it to my friends—it's a super yard tool!
customer_reviews.author: Macahuna

customer_reviews.title: Chews Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw for topping Crepe Myrtles. It cuts remarkable well. Using it with the extension handle requires muscle and a stable footing due to the weight and movement required in use. But that's part of having a quality tool with a long life expectancy. It cuts better than I expected, especially for cuts below head level.
customer_reviews.author: Pillsbury

customer_reviews.title: the next one we recieved works fine. it does help after cutting something to push ...
customer_reviews.text: the first one we recieved, something was wrong with the chain, it kept coming off even though it was self tightening or adjusting. we called the JawSaw company, they said to return it to Amazon. the next one we recieved works fine. it does help after cutting something to push the handle in again to clear away any remaining debris. havent used the extension yet. if you have a good size property get some long extension cords. we have two 50' extension cords.
customer_reviews.author: David J Serada

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Not as easy as it looks. I prefer a pole saw
customer_reviews.author: Katman

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw.
customer_reviews.text: Unpacked this saw, added bar & chain oil (there was a small bottle included), plugged in and away I went. This saw works amazingly well. I buzzed through branches from 1 1/2 - 4" in diameter without any trouble at all. Although this unit is only a 5 amp draw, it seems to be quite powerful and worked very well for me. I will be using it this weekend and I look forward to it.
customer_reviews.author: John Monty

customer_reviews.title: Good Trimming Tool for LOW Branches
customer_reviews.text: The saw does not reach the advertised height. It is also very clumsy to use when trying to reach branches high up in the tree. On a positive note, it does a great job cutting and makes short work of trimming as long as branches are no too high in the tree. Dragging the power cord around can get to be cumbersome, but that is true of all electric tools, and is preferable to those balky gas motors.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: great little chain saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw just isn't built for big jobs, but it does small ones very very well. I used mine to trim 6 lilac bushes/trees and it was great. Perfect for trimming from the tree and then using on the ground to cut branches down to manageable sizes for disposal. Was a bit tricky getting the chain tension set correctly, but once I figured that out this thing allowed me to get my job done quickly. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: FoCoLew81

customer_reviews.title: Better than my regular chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Works great for 4-inch diameter or less. Easy to use and oil. Chain slips, so I keep it tight. Easy to change the chain. Extension pole is nice but very nose heavy.
customer_reviews.author: D C McKay

customer_reviews.title: Safe and effective; dont count on Amazon 2 day prime!
customer_reviews.text: Delivery from Amazon was two work days late. Causing us to miss the once a month limb pick up resulting in added hauling and disposal fees at sanitation depot. Saw performed well as expected, however chain slips off several times an hour. Therefore productivity is not increased but much more safe for workers than traditional chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: The Lee's

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy
customer_reviews.text: The Jaw Saw is excellent but the extension is useless. You would need to be a Navy Seal to use this. As an experiment put 15 pounds on the end of a broom stick and see if you can hold it up. If you can, buy the extension. As a senior citizen I wanted something that would keep me off a ladder. This looked like a perfect solution. I wish I was an Olympic weightlifter so that I could use the extension.
customer_reviews.author: Aero

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tree trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Packaging appeared damaged, but product was fine. This item makes short work of trimming trees and cleaning up the limbs. Heavier to operate that company's website implies, but not too heavy. Definitely worth the money. Fairly easy to attach/detach the extension handle. Instructions are easy to follow. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Highlander

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended at all
customer_reviews.text: Nothing. Chair kept coming off. So heavy very hard to hold up over your head and use. Not recommended at all. Use it for 30 seconds and the saw blade comes off. Absolutely worthless.
customer_reviews.author: DavidK

customer_reviews.title: Jawsaw
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly pleased with how well this saw actually works. I knew it wouldn't be as powerful as a gas saw before I bought it but it makes short work of the many branches that keep coming down as well as allowing me to get the dead ones still low enough to the ground but out of arms reach. I'm in a wheelchair so being able to operate this saw with only one hand is great, no more leaning over to cut while trying to maintain my balance. The only down side I've found is the extension handle could be a little longer and the weight is a little much when lifting to trim branches from trees.
customer_reviews.author: cobweb

customer_reviews.title: Not as marketed.
customer_reviews.text: marketing material said it would extend 12 ft it did not. Also that it could be used to cut high tree branches, box even showed a picture of a person holding the saw over their head into tree limbs. However, the directions specifically said not to extend your arms and hold above head. Very disappointed as I really like the brand
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing. It does everything they claim it does
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. It does everything they claim it does, with ease, right out of the box. On first impression it feels a little flemsy but it's not. The only problem I have had is the chain does come off on occasion but with it being enclosed in the housing, it's not a problem. At this point I'm not sure the self adjusting tension bolt lives up to the claims.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!  And one hint
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What an easy to use tool! And so far I've just used it for cutting 6" limbs up into smaller pieces. One piece of advice: make sure you get the blade spinning BEFORE you start cutting; and after cutting all the way through a limb make sure you slowly turn it off. Phil
customer_reviews.author: Phil Vitkus

customer_reviews.title: Best gift
customer_reviews.text: I gave it to my husband for Christmas and he hadn't open it until now. Our tree was in bad shape and we were worried about it falling on our neighbor's roof. The storm was about on the way so he grabbed JawSaw and cut it off for only 20 minutes. It was amazed fast and easy!! He absolutely LOVES it. He said it was the best gift he ever had.
customer_reviews.author: K. Williamsmirus

customer_reviews.title: I don't "not" recommend, but you need to have the right use ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my husband, but he rarely uses. I bought the extension, but it's too heavy to hold up and we don't have a lot of need for low hanging branches. I don't "not" recommend, but you need to have the right use for it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Tree Trimming made easy...
customer_reviews.text: The winter and spring storms have made a mess of my large tree in the front yard, and it was necessary to trim away the broken branches. Because of the small motor, its a little on the "heavy" side at one end when using the extension handle, but that's to be expected. Attaching and detaching couldn't have been simpler. Im good with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Roadie-Roadrunner

customer_reviews.title: Really helpful Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent chain saw for those of us who are not used to the real thing. I lack upper arm strength, so it felt like 5-15 pounds heavy when I was trimming my 15 ft tree. It did a great job though. I really recommend it for inexperienced, not strong people like me.
customer_reviews.author: Josealarcon3

customer_reviews.title: Good for clearing and trimming and cutting moderate diameter firewood
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty much as advertised. It is safer and easier than a chain saw. I use it with a heavy gauge extension cord and can reach every part of my lot I much prefer electric power to a cutter with an integral fuel tank.. My only disappointment is that the chain frequently goes off track no matter what adjustments I attempt.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Still have all my parts
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing since sliced bread. I took out all my scrubs in one afternoon which would have taken forever if I had to get inside the bushes to cut them. With this, I shove it in the bush to the trunk and push the plunger and walk away....job done. Not a scratch or scrape on me since I didn't contact the limbs with my limbs.
customer_reviews.author: ben1955r

customer_reviews.title: First time buying a product that I saw on an ...
customer_reviews.text: First time buying a product that I saw on an infomercial But it worked well cutting ground brush, vines and tree limbs. A regular chain does not work well cutting heavy brush, but this saw with the mouth holds the brush to cut it than you can work your way down and cut the thick stuff on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Loyal Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: JawSaw
customer_reviews.text: The JawSaw is absolutely fantastic. I have woods behind my house and have let several saplings grow. As a result, nobody can enjoy a walk by the stream. The JawSaw has made it very easy to clear the area (I'm still working on it). The only problem I have had is cutting my extension cord one time. I would like to see a design to keep the cord away from the jaws.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Quick
customer_reviews.text: So quick to cut branches off tree. Can not cut a big trunk but branches better than a saw.
customer_reviews.author: Ski

customer_reviews.title: not a 12 ft extension pole
customer_reviews.text: The product does not reach 12 ft with extension. I will need a 6 ft step ladder to make it reach 12 ft. The main reason I wanted this product,is because some high branches over my drive way that I wanted to remove, plus some other branches around the property. It takes a little bit to get use to handling this product
customer_reviews.author: lew

customer_reviews.title: Worx JawSaw Pluses, and Minuses
customer_reviews.text: The Worx Jaw Saw does an excellent job of cutting. The idea of an open claw (jaw) serving as a guard for the operating blade and protecting it is an ideal design to hold the saw in place during cuitting. The other plus in the design of the Saw Jaw is the is the oscillating small blade enhoused in the Jaw making for easier and safer cutting. I used the Saw for the first time this afternoon, Friday, !/ 16/ 2015. It met what I desired in it's performance. Downside: The head, working end, is extra heavy, especially with the extension attachment. I highly recommend the tool. Bill Alexander
customer_reviews.author: Bill Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Safe Power Saw, Great For Tree Limbs
customer_reviews.text: The JawSaw works very well for tree limbs and I took several trailer loads down after purchasing. I believe it to be the safest option for standing on a ladder and using a power operated saw.
customer_reviews.author: E Hickey

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the saw for trimming palm trees in Fla., it is ideal for that. It works just as well at ground level for pruning trees. I had to learn to balance the weight of the saw against the palm trunk while sliding it to the desired height, made it doable for my 61 year old self, even on a step ladder. Price was much better than the big-box stores as well!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Sukup

customer_reviews.title: I love the ease of using it
customer_reviews.text: I love it, it did exactly What I needed it to do. I used it to trim limbs at my house and ran out of limbs to cut. I wanted to do more so I cut the limbs up smaller.
customer_reviews.author: debra reed

customer_reviews.title: Electric circular saw..
customer_reviews.text: It works OK except that the chain comes off every time I use it. It works OK then I put the chain back on, then it works OK and I put the chain back on and it works OK......Came quick and it does help to keep my lilac trees in shape and my miniture fruit trees and the 100 foot maple tree..at least the lower area that I can reach.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Works as good as scene on TV. One warning - don't try to cut a branch thicker than a 3 inch diameter or the chain will fall (so I've been told.) I haven't had a problem. Great for trimming small trees. Just make sure your extension cord does not get in the saw. My neighbor had it happen (klutz!)
customer_reviews.author: D. Quack

customer_reviews.title: Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a good chain saw for small jobs, a little bit on the heavy side; so it is not a saw for someone that does not have alot of upper body strength, mainly if you are using it with the pole attached, as it gets pretty heavy and hard to handle, but is still a good saw to have around. I would give it an 8 out of a score of 1 to 10 without the pole, and a 5 with the pole.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dunniway

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool! I have had this now for three years and I am still in love with it!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bonds

customer_reviews.title: this unit was perfect! I suppose it's going to depend on your ...
customer_reviews.text: For what I needed it for, this unit was perfect! I suppose it's going to depend on your requirements but for mine it just plain worked well. I had to top out 30 trees that were over 20 feet high and get them down to 10" each. Buzzed right through them in short time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I thought this would be a good addition to my arsenal for smaller jobs
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a good addition to my arsenal for smaller jobs. Unfortunately, the chain would not stay on the device more that 1 minute at a time. I spent a couple of hours trying different tensions on the chain, etc. with no luck. For the short time it worked, 6 different tries, it functioned pretty well. I would like to hear ideas on making this work correctly. I will scrutinize these types of things much more closely in the future.
customer_reviews.author: gtillery@mindspring.com

customer_reviews.title: OMG, It actually works
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured ot to loosen the chain a bunch before retightening I no longer had any problems with the chain coming off. The few days I have used it have saved enough time and effort to make it all worth it. I love the safety of it and the ease of use. The fake reviews on the compnay's own site gave me pause, but despite that sleaze the product works well.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Abrams

customer_reviews.title: I can do it now myself.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing like it for small jobs around the house. A little heavy but that's to be expected. Great purchase. I would strongly recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie A. Williams-morys

customer_reviews.title: The WORX JawSaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for getting to those trimming projects that one has been putting off. It is a quiet running machine, easy to operate, and maintain. It is a little heavier then I was expecting especially when using the optional extension pole. The extension pole is a must have, the tool itself does not allow one to reach very high into those overhead projects. It is electric so you are tethered to an extension cord but I believe this is outweighed by the ease of use, how light it is compared to a chain saw, safety of the jaws, optional extension pole, and how quiet it runs compared to a chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Casper

customer_reviews.title: JawSaw is Excellent!!!
customer_reviews.text: The JawSaw works great!!! I feel so safe while I am cutting down my substantial brush pile very quickly. I have not tried the extension yet.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert M. Payan

customer_reviews.title: wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Thank you Amazon. I will loving this item. I saw it on an informical and was tempted to but it but it cost too much. It was very easy to put together and in a matter of minutes I (a female) was cutting limbs in my back yard as easy as slicing a pie. Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: Very Safe and does the job.
customer_reviews.text: A bit difficult to understand the extension cord required but most being sold today meet the need. Haven't bought one in awhile. If you are cutting above your head it is heavy but definitely easier to use than climbing a tree or cutting from a step ladder with a generic chain saw or hand saw. Buy it you will like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jawsaw
customer_reviews.text: Faantastic tool for older people such as me. I like the light weight and the safety features. Cuts exactly as a regular chain saw without all the headaches that come with some of them. Even with the extension pole, it is easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: JawSaw Meets All Expectations
customer_reviews.text: The JawSaw performed as expected... but the extension handle did not. I used it once... and it is no longer usable. I cut a tree limb, extending the pole and myself as far as possible. When the chain cut completely through the limb, the unit slipped off the tree limb stump and... fell to the ground because the weight was all at the other end. The JawSaw hit the ground... no damage. HOWEVER, the extension pole bent and can no longer be used. I'll have to revert to the ladder in the future when cutting limbs up high. The Extension Handle does not meet the 'standard' that the rest of Worx products provide.
customer_reviews.author: John A Mangum

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: the chain does come off a lot- but for small cuts here and there this is great! and quick
customer_reviews.author: Fishman-MD

customer_reviews.title: Don,t reach.
customer_reviews.text: It worhs as they say if you have arms like Arnold,my wife and I can use it without the extension,but no way with the extension.do like the safety factor of not worry about the blade cutting you.Would buy again but without extension,for cutting lower limbs,leave the higher stuff to the experts!
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box, added oil, and plugged it in. My brother was able trim bothersome branches immediately. The ease of use attracted the attention of interested neighbors. I recommended the WORX on the spot. This tool will save me a ton of $$$.
customer_reviews.author: Bernardine M. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Ok But Be Advised
customer_reviews.text: In general, I'm happy with this product. If I had it to do again, I would not purchase the extension handle as it is quite bulky and hard to maneuver unless you have unusual upper body strength. Also, during one of my initial uses, the chain did come off and was not particularly simple to get back on with appropriate tension.
customer_reviews.author: WCHRISB

customer_reviews.title: Love my JawSaw
customer_reviews.text: I love my JawSaw. I have a lot of trees in my yard and have to trim and cut down saplings. The JawSaw makes this easy. The only reason I do not give it 6 stars is because, when the extension pole is attached, unless you have good arm and upper body strength, it is hard to maneuver and use. Otherwise it is GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: OldBroad52

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a great alternative to the standard chainsaw death trap
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a great alternative to the standard chainsaw death trap. I've been able to take down branches, cut them up, and even take down small trees. It gets pretty heavy when it's attached to the extension, and I've had the chain slip off once. Those are my only complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It was amazing..but the chain came off after 10 uses.
customer_reviews.author: robertdegeorge

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME TOOL
customer_reviews.text: THIS CHAIN SAW IS GREAT FOR ME. I WAS ALWAYS AFRAID OF REGULAR CHAIN SAWS BECAUSE OF THE KICK-BACK AND OTHER ISSUES. THIS WAS VERY EASY TO USE CUT THROUGH WOOD VERY EASILY AND I DID NOT HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT CUTTING INTO THE DIRT. HAVE NOT TRIED THINNER STICKS AND HAVE NOT TRIED THE EXTENSION BUT HOPEFULLY THEY WILL WORK JUST AS WELL. THE ONLY ISSUE I HAD WAS THE CHAIN FELL OFF A COUPLE OF TIMES WHICH I'LL NEED TO FIGURE OUT HOWEVER THAT WAS NOT SIGNIFICANT ENOUGH TO TAINT MY REVIEW.
customer_reviews.author: ko

product_meta.title: Worx WG308, 5 Amp 6-inch JawSaw Corded Electric Chainsaw with Extension Pole
product_meta.description: The WORX JawSaw electric limbing and trimming chainsaw is the perfect tool for storm debris or tough pruning jobs. The JawSaw takes the hassle out of using an ordinary chain saw, while making heavy-duty limb and brush clean-up safe, quick and easy. With the included Extend pole, the JawSaw is two tools in one! Forget the ladder -- the extension pole attachment, extends the JawSaw's reach up to 12-feet, making it perfect for pruning and cutting hard-to-reach limbs. The extension pole requires no tools to attach and can be removed in seconds. The WORX JawSaw is powered by electricity, so it produces no noxious emissions. Different from gas-powered chain saws, our electric JawSaw doesn't require you to mix oil and gas or deal with difficult start-ups. It also . It also features an automatic oiler that provides constant lubrication to both the bar and chain.
feature_bullets: Bar measures 6 inches; 4-inch maximum cutting length; weighs 11.7 pounds
This model(WG308 ) consists of a jawsaw (model#WG307) and an extension pole (model#WA0163)
Electric pruner/chainsaw with extension handle for cutting extra-tall branches
5 amp saw is powered entirely by electricity, with no gas, oil, or noxious emissions.Enclosed jaw guard around chain keeps cuts focused and fingers safe
Cuts limbs up to 12 feet high; easy-to-use single-bolt Auto-Tension system

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars657 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
